articles.title: Consumer Watchdog Alert Warns CA Voters Not To Sign Uber's 'License to Kill' Ballot Measure: Uber Reviving Deadly Robotaxis In Conjunction With Proposal For Loss of Legal Accountability
articles.mainIdea: Consumer Watchdog Alert Warns CA Voters Not To Sign Uber's 'License to Kill' Ballot Measure: Uber Reviving Deadly Robotaxis In Conjunction With Proposal For Loss of Legal Accountability
articles.summary: PR Newswire: Consumer Watchdog Alert Warns CA Voters Not To Sign Uber's 'License to Kill' Ballot Measure: Uber Reviving Deadly Robotaxis In Conjunction With Proposal For Loss of Legal Accountability. Consumer Watchdog Campaign published a Consumer Alert video warning California voters that a reason Uber is pushing a ballot measure to limit innocent accident victims' rights to medical recovery and representation is that it plans to bring back its deadly self-driving robotaxi.

articles.title: NH charges Uber with deceptive practices
articles.mainIdea: NH charges Uber with deceptive practices
articles.summary: New Hampshire Union Leader, Manchester: NH charges Uber with deceptive practices. New Hampshire has joined a multistate lawsuit charging owners of the Uber ridesharing business with engaging in deceptive billing and cancellation practices through its Uber One subscription service. articles.title: Watchdog Warns Uber Users To Take A Lyft Following NY Times Report That Uber Let Violent Felons, Rapists Drive, Background Check System Built To Fail, Says Consumer Watchdog
articles.mainIdea: Watchdog Warns Uber Users To Take A Lyft Following NY Times Report That Uber Let Violent Felons, Rapists Drive, Background Check System Built To Fail, Says Consumer Watchdog
articles.summary: PR Newswire: Watchdog Warns Uber Users To Take A Lyft Following NY Times Report That Uber Let Violent Felons, Rapists Drive, Background Check System Built To Fail, Says Consumer Watchdog. The nonprofit Consumer Watchdog warned Uber users to start using Lyft after a blockbuster New York Times report. The report found Uber's background check system let criminals convicted of crimes like child abuse, assault and stalking drive for Uber, as long as the conviction was more than seven years old. The report also found that the system has many gaps, often intentionally imposed, to allow for speed and to keep costs low. Lyft, by contrast, bans drivers convicted of violent felonies wheneve
